articles.author: Richard Speed
articles.title: ESA's ERS-2 satellite began to come apart earlier than predicted - The Register
articles.description: Harmlessly entered over the North Pacific, but solar array was already bent
articles.content: The European Space Agency's ERS-2 satellite has re-entered the Earth's atmosphere. While no damage to property was reported, some impressive shots were taken of the spacecraft starting to buckle as i… [+2099 chars]

articles.title: Ministers consider new vaping tax at Budget next week - BBC.com
articles.description: Ministers fear that the relatively cheap cost of vaping makes it more accessible for young people.
articles.content:
By Henry Zeffman & Paul SeddonBBC News
The government is considering announcing a new tax on vapes at the Budget next week.
